title: Supreme Court Reviews Trump's Tariffs, Questions Presidential Power
snippets: At issue is whether the president can bypass Congress and impose tariffs by citing national security.
Trump's administration is trying to defend his tariffs after lower courts ruled that he had exceeded his authority.
President Donald Trump calls the Supreme Court case on his tariffs a matter of "life or death" for the United States.
Case could determine the future of the US president’s global trade agenda

summary: The Supreme Court is evaluating the legality of President Trump's tariffs, imposed citing national security, after lower courts deemed he overstepped his authority. The case, critical for Trump's trade agenda, has seen skepticism from justices, questioning the broad use of tariffs without Congress approval. The outcome will influence the extent of presidential powers in trade matters.

title: UPS Plane Crash in Kentucky Kills 11, Causes Shipping Delays
snippets: Investigators find 'black boxes' from UPS plane crash that killed at least 11 Reuters

A UPS cargo plane's left wing caught fire and an engine fell off just before it crashed and exploded after takeoff in Kentucky, a federal investigator said Wednesday, offering the first official details about a disaster that killed at least 11 people, including a child.

The crash, which saw the plane's left wing catch fire and an engine detach, has contributed to a deadly year for air travel. Shipping delays are anticipated following the incident. Investigators have recovered the black boxes to determine the cause.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi in Philippines: 114 Dead, 127 Missing, Cebu Worst-Hit
snippets: Philippines begins cleanup after Typhoon Kalmaegi leaves at least 85 dead Reuters
Residents say powerful storm brought 'raging' flash floods that destroyed homes, overturned cars and blocked streets.

Kalmaegi is heading towards Vietnam after floods and high winds caused dozens of deaths in the central Philippines. Cebu, the worst-hit province, is still recovering from a recent devastating earthquake.

Among the 66 fatalities were six military personnel whose helicopter crashed on the island of Mindanao during a humanitarian mission Typhoon Kalmaegi has left at least 66 people dead with 26 others missing in the central Philippines, many in widespread flooding that trapped people on their roofs and
Many of the victims drowned, the authorities said. Hundreds of thousands of people had evacuated before Typhoon Kalmaegi hit on Tuesday.

Philippine officials said Wednesday the death toll from the widespread flooding and devastation caused by Typhoon Kalmaegi in the country's central region has risen to at least 114, with 127 others reported missing, many of them in a hard-hit province still recovering from a deadly earthquake.
titles: Philippines begins cleanup after Typhoon Kalmaegi leaves at least 85 dead - Reuters

At least 114 dead after Typhoon Kalmaegi floods Philippines, engulfing entire communities
summary: Typhoon Kalmaegi hit the central Philippines, causing widespread flooding and destruction, resulting in at least 114 deaths and 127 people missing. The storm brought severe flash floods, destroying homes and infrastructure, with Cebu province being the worst-hit area. Prior to the typhoon, hundreds of thousands had evacuated. Among the deceased were six military personnel involved in a humanitarian mission. The typhoon is now moving towards Vietnam. Cleanup efforts have begun in the affected regions.

Mamdani, who was influenced by Bernie Sanders and opposes the centrist adoption of right-wing language, promises to form a capable and compassionate administration. His transition team includes notable figures such as FTC Commissioner Lina Khan.

title: Mexican President Sheinbaum Files Charges Against Groper
snippets: Mexico President Sheinbaum presses charges after street groping incident AP News
Claudia Sheinbaum has pressed charges against the man, who was filmed groping her while she was walking near the presidential palace. The incident has reignited debate about women's safety in Mexico.
Mexico’s first female president said she is pressing charges against her assailant, sending a message in a country where harassment of women is common.

Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Wednesday that she had filed a criminal complaint against a man who groped and tried to kiss her as she greeted members of the public, a day after a video of the incident went viral.

This measure aims to help contain the deadly wave of bear-related incidents terrorizing locals.

title: Chinese Astronauts' Return Delayed After Space Debris Hits Capsule
snippets: Three Chinese taikonauts — Wang Jie, Chen Zhongrui and Chen Dong — will be extending their stay aboard China's Tiangong space station after their return capsule was struck by a presumed piece of orbital debris on Wednesday.

The three astronauts from the Shenzhou-20 mission flew to the Tiangong space station in April, and were expected to return on Wednesday The return to Earth of three Chinese astronauts has been delayed until an unspecified date after their spacecraft was apparently struck by a small piece of debris,
titles: Three Chinese astronauts stranded in space after debris hits their return capsule
Return of Chinese astronauts delayed after spacecraft struck by debris
summary: Three Chinese astronauts, Wang Jie, Chen Zhongrui, and Chen Dong, will extend their stay on the Tiangong space station due to their return capsule being hit by presumed orbital debris. Originally set to return to Earth on Wednesday after arriving in April on the Shenzhou-20 mission, their return has been postponed indefinitely.

title: New Studies Unveil Brain Development Insights and Inflammation's Role

summary: Recent studies published in Nature explore the spatial dynamics of brain development and the role of neuroinflammation in humans and other mammals. These studies provide new insights into how the brain develops and the impact of inflammation on this process, marking significant advancements in the field of neuroscience.

title: Studies Unveil Detailed Maps of Developing Human Brain
snippets: Lineage-resolved atlas of the developing human cortex Nature
BICCN: A cell census of the developing human brain Nature
titles: Lineage-resolved atlas of the developing human cortex - Nature
BICCN: A cell census of the developing human brain - Nature
summary: Two recent studies published in Nature, "Lineage-resolved atlas of the developing human cortex" and "BICCN: A cell census of the developing human brain," provide comprehensive analyses of the developing human brain. The first study offers a detailed map of the human cortex's development at the cellular level, while the second presents a census of cell types in the developing brain. Together, these works enhance our understanding of human brain development and its complexity.
